intro: Astragalus paktiensis, commonly known as the Tibetan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small,蝶形 (butterfly-shaped) flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind. Astragalus paktiensis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments with poor soil conditions. Its ecological role includes nitrogen fixation, which enriches the soil in its native habitat.
